root_causes: Validator uses variable S2 but expected Variable ID is S2_1
Validator does not respect the entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') — it will run even when question was not shown
instructions: Use the correct variable name S2_1 in the validation expressions instead of S2.

Apply the entry condition so the check only runs when the question was shown. For example, wrap the validation in the qSurveyType condition: sel if f_qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(S2_1) or S2_1 < 0 or S2_1 > 99).
Keep the numeric range check 0 to 99 inclusive. If the question is required, continue to flag missing values; if it is optional, do not flag miss(S2_1).

root_causes: Validator uses variable S3 but expected Variable ID is S3_1
Validator does not respect the entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') — it will run even when question was not shown
instructions: Use the correct variable name S3_1 in the validation expressions instead of S3.
Apply the entry condition so the check only runs when the question was shown. For example: sel if f_qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(S3_1) or S3_1 < 0 or S3_1 > 100).
Maintain the numeric bounds 0–100 inclusive. If decimals are allowed (precision up to 3), ensure data type accepts decimals; do not enforce integer-only validation unless required.

root_causes: Validator does not apply the entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') — it will validate even when the question was not shown
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation only runs when the question was displayed. For example: sel if f_qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(S4) or ~any(S4,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,21,22,23,31,32,33,34,36,37,41,42,43,44,45,51,52,53,61,62,63,64,65,66,67,68,69,70,71,98)).
Otherwise the allowed-code check using any(...) is correct and the list of codes matches the expected answers.

root_causes: Validator does not enforce the entry condition f('qCountry').any('7') && isTest() — it will run even when the question was not shown
Question attribute NotRequired=true means missing should NOT be flagged, but the script currently flags miss(HidS4DE) as invalid
instructions: Restrict validation to when the question was displayed: include the entry condition (e.g., sel if f_qCountry = 7 and isTest() and ...).

Because NotRequired is true, do not flag missing values. Change the selection to only flag invalid non-missing values, for example: sel if f_qCountry = 7 and isTest() and (not miss(HidS4DE) and ~any(HidS4DE,1,2)).
Keep the allowed-code check (1 or 2) for non-missing responses.

root_causes: Validator does not apply the entry condition f('qCountry').any('1033') && f('HidS1Group2').any('1') — it will validate even when the question was not shown
instructions: Apply the entry condition so the check runs only when qCountry=1033 and HidS1Group2=1. For example: sel if f_qCountry = 1033 and HidS1Group2 = 1 and (miss(S4a0) or ~any(S4a0,1,2)).
Keep the Yes/No allowed-code check (1/2). If the question is required, continue to flag missing; otherwise, do not flag missing.

root_causes: Expected entry condition is false (question never shown), but the validator unconditionally checks S4a and will flag missing values
Validator will produce false positives because it does not account for the question being hidden/not asked
instructions: Remove the unconditional validation for S4a. Do not run any checks if entry_conditions is false (the question is not shown).

If the question may be shown under different logic in other builds, only run the validation when the appropriate entry condition is true. Otherwise, delete or disable this validation block to avoid flagging all respondents as missing.
